reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and had a wonderful stay. The service at the desk was top notch and the hotel is in a perfect location to walk all over Colmar and be able to walk to the train for a day trip to Strasbourg. Our room was very clean with modern bathroom amenities. We had a standard room that was a bit cramped but certainly functional. Great hot water and pressure in the shower. Of our eight days in France and Germany we had one of our best meals in the Hotel Rapp restaurant (and we are foodies!).
reviews.title: Perfectly Located and Excellent restaurant
Great location, Service and the Amenities
reviews.text: We will certainly go back and stay here, just upgrade our room. Only gripe-the bed linen could be upgraded.

I spent 3 nights in Colmar traveling by myself – I stayed in a superior single (room 102) which faces the street. I wanted a hotel I felt safe in but was also nicely located, not too far from the train or from the center of town but still quiet. I also wanted a hotel that had the option of breakfast and possibly a restaurant. This hotel met all my needs perfectly. The superior single was certainly big enough and would have even been fine had I been traveling with my partner. The room smelled nice and clean, the linens felt fresh, it had a bathrobe, and they clean linens daily if I needed it. The breakfast was a nice continental spread (and a lot of options which was nice since it costs per night).
reviews.title: Hidden gem.

reviews.text: The front desk staff spoke very good English and answered all my questions and helped me with anything I needed. I didn't give an "excellent" for only one reason - although the food was excellent - I only ate in the restaurant one evening. It was a bit fancier than I'm used to but it was the staff that turned me off – they were loitering and staring me down as I ate which was unnerving (initially I was alone in the restaurant). I also wasn't sure how to eat everything the right way (since I ordered some French foods) and the staff in the restaurant didn't really know English - one gentleman did but only basic words - making my restaurant experience a bit difficult. Most of the other restaurants I ate in within France were a better experience than this one. Perhaps it was timing or just the staff, but I was just uncomfortable having many people standing by me watching me eat.
reviews.title: Lovely spot, perfectly fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed at Le Rapp over Xmas 2010. All of the staff, from reception to restaurant were exceptionally polite, friendly and helpful. This is the best hotel we stayed at and we felt at home, they have a free WiFi and an internet computer in the lobby. We dined in the superb restaurant most nights and had booked in advance for the Xmas Eve special dinner. The food served every night was awesome and although not cheap was very generous in portion sizes and well worth every penny along with the fantastic Alsace wines. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the old town and is very close to the Christmas markets (there are four in total), which is a big drawcard for Colmar. We had a perfect white xmas and cannot stop raving about this beautiful hotel and city.
reviews.title: Useful to know about

reviews.text: Very nice staff...was very helpful and friendly. On Site parking nearby in Hotel garage fro 10 Euro per day. Location ideal for walking into Colmar. Room was well taken care and comfortable. Bathroom was in good shape also. Swimming Pool in the basement is a definite plus! Highly Recommended for a base to tour the Alsace region from.

So we had to drive out again and reenter. These informations should be given on booking, so your first impressions of Colmar aren't coming in and out of carparks.

reviews.text: Travelling through France to our holiday in Provence we spent one night at le Rapp. Quite easy to find in the midst of Colmar, close to the "Venice-area" and the restaurants and shops. Closed parking 15 meters away, friendly staff and very nice breakfast buffet on the positive side. The also have a bar and their own restaurant, though most of the action is down at the Venice area. No reason for not coming back!

reviews.text: My husband and I are staying here for three days. My sister stayed here some years ago. Central location, friendly staff. I feel that breakfast should be included in the price. The pool, sauna, and steam room were funky, but were welcoming after a day in Colmar and hoer Alsace villages.

reviews.title: Very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in a large double room, and it was excellent. The room was large, even by US standards, the bed was extremely comfortable, and there was plenty of storage. The bathroom was large and airy as well, with both a soaking tub and a shower. The air conditioning worked well, which was a benefit since the weather was occasionally warm. Front desk staff were welcoming and helpful, the bar was comfortable, and the breakfast buffet was comprehensive and of high quality. The hotel has no parking, but a large public parking lot is available across the street. One negative to note: the hotel is on a small sidestreet and is difficult to find. Be sure you have a map to its exact location. Knowling generally where it is will not be good enough to find it. The hotel restaurant is excellent, by the way, and well worth trying for authentic Alsatian food.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and restaurant in Colmar
